name: Proctor's Skeptical Astrology
description: A critical examination of astrology based on Richard A. Proctor's 'Myths and Marvels of Astronomy' (1896). Presents traditional astrological concepts with sardonic Victorian commentary, exposing logical fallacies while documenting the historical claims.

interpretations.story: Saturn is the Greater Infortune, 'by universal experience acknowledged to be the most potent, evil, and malignant of all the planets.' Those born under him have 'small, black, leering eyes, thick lips and nostrils, large ears, thin face, lowering looks, cloudy aspect.' The most certain characteristic: 'he will never look thee in the face.' Chaucer summarizes: 'My loking is the fader of pestilence.'
interpretations.light: Constant in friendship, laborious, patient, enduring—if you can endure him
interpretations.shadow: Drowning, prison, strangling, rebellion, poisoning, ruin, cold diseases, dark treasons—'the fader of pestilence'

interpretations.story: Jupiter is 'the most propitious of all the planets, and the native born under his influence has every reason to be jovial in fact as he is by nature.' Such natives will be 'tall and fair, handsome and erect, robust, ruddy, and altogether a good-looking person.' Unless Jupiter is afflicted—then he denotes 'quacks and mountebanks, knaves, cheats, and drunkards.'
interpretations.light: Judges, counsellors, church dignitaries, scholars, woollendrapers (possibly explaining the woolsack)
interpretations.shadow: When afflicted: quacks, mountebanks, knaves, cheats, and drunkards—quite a fall from cardinals to drunkards

interpretations.story: Mars, the Lesser Infortune, makes natives 'of fierce countenance, his eyes sparkling, or sharp and darting, his complexion fiery or yellowish, and his countenance scarred or furrowed.' Hair color depends on sign: watery sign gives flaxen hair, earthy gives chestnut. 'The influence of Saturn may be compared to a lingering but fatal consumption; that of Mars to a burning fever.'
interpretations.light: Generals, surgeons, barbers, smiths, sculptors, cooks—'all cut throat people'
interpretations.shadow: When afflicted with Mercury or Moon: thieves, hangmen, and 'all cut throat people' (literally this time)

interpretations.story: The solar native has 'a round face (like pictures of the sun in old books of astronomy), with a short chin.' The Sun is 'the natural significator of respectability; for which I can discover no reason, unless it be that the sun travelling always in the ecliptic has no latitude, and so solar folk are allowed none.' When ill aspected: 'proud and mean, tyrannical and sycophantic.'
interpretations.light: Emperors, kings, titled folk, goldsmiths, jewellers, coiners—the respectable (or those pretending to be)
interpretations.shadow: When afflicted: 'pretenders either to power or knowledge'—arrogance and ignorant pomposity

interpretations.story: 'The native of Venus hath a love-dimple in the chin, a lovely mouth, cherry lips, and a right merry countenance.' Venus's benevolence was proven, according to Raphael (1828), by 'our present beloved monarch' George IV—'a most illustrious proof of the celestial science.' (George IV was notorious for dissipation, which Proctor notes with evident irony.)
interpretations.light: Musicians, embroiderers, perfumers, classic modellers—those who administer to luxuries of the great
interpretations.shadow: When afflicted: 'the lower orders of the votaries of voluptuousness'

interpretations.story: Mercury is 'a cold, dry, melancholy star.' The Mercurial has 'high forehead and thin sharp nose, thin beard (many times none at all), slender of body, and with small weak eyes.' When well affected: 'a strong, vigorous, active mind.' Long slender hands and fingers are 'especial marks of Mercury.'
interpretations.light: Astrologers, philosophers, mathematicians, politicians, merchants, poets—all ingenious, clever men
interpretations.shadow: When ill affected: pettifoggers, cunning vile persons, thieves, messengers, footmen, and servants

interpretations.story: The Moon's natives are 'of good stature, fair, and pale, moon-faced, with grey eyes, short arms, thick hands and feet, smooth, corpulent and phlegmatic body.' When in watery signs: 'he or she is blub-cheeked, not a handsome body, but a muddling creature.' 'Unless the moon is very well aspected, she ever signifies an ordinary vulgar person.'
interpretations.light: Sailors, all persons connected with water or any kind of fluid, those in inferior and common offices
interpretations.shadow: The muddling creature: blub-cheeked, ordinary, vulgar—unless very well aspected

interpretations.story: 'It is unfortunate for astrology that nothing was ever observed which seemed to suggest the possibility of an unknown planet. Astrologers tell us now that Uranus is a very potent planet; yet the old astrologers seem to have got on very well without him.' Raphael falsely claimed Halley and Bradley discovered Uranus through perturbation analysis—'Of course there is not a word of truth in this.'
interpretations.light: If well aspected: profound in secret sciences, magnanimous, lofty of mind
interpretations.shadow: Uranus is 'peculiarly hostile to' women, 'and very evil in love.' Beware marriage when Uranus afflicts!

interpretations.story: Aries is 'vernal, dry, fiery, masculine, cardinal, equinoctial, diurnal, movable, commanding, eastern, choleric, violent, and quadrupedalian.' It 'signifies a dry constitution, long face and neck, thick shoulders, swarthy complexion, and a hasty, passionate temper.' Governs head and face. Reigns over England, France, Germany, Syria, Naples, Verona.
interpretations.light: Fortunate, commanding, initiating—the house of Mars at its most martial
interpretations.shadow: Hasty, passionate, violent, choleric—'destruction by burning, and murder'

interpretations.story: Taurus 'gives to the native a stout athletic frame, broad bull-like forehead, dark curly hair, short neck, and so forth, and a dull apathetic temper, exceedingly cruel and malicious if once aroused.' Governs neck and throat. Reigns over Ireland, Holland, Persia, Leipzig. Feminine and unfortunate.
interpretations.light: Stout, athletic, strong—physical power if nothing else
interpretations.shadow: Dull, apathetic, but 'exceedingly cruel and malicious if once aroused'—the sleeping bull

interpretations.story: The native of Gemini will have 'sanguine complexion and tall, straight figure, dark eyes quick and piercing, brown hair, active ways, and will be of exceedingly ingenious intellect.' Governs arms and shoulders. Rules London (the great fire, plague, and London Bridge all occurred when Gemini was prominent—or so astrologers claim after the fact).
interpretations.light: Ingenious intellect, quick eyes, active ways—Mercury's house at its best
interpretations.shadow: Post-hoc reasoning: any major London event gets attributed to Gemini after it happens

interpretations.story: Cancer natives are 'of fair but pale complexion, round face, grey or mild blue eyes, weak voice, the upper part of the body large, slender arms, small feet, and an effeminate constitution.' Governs breast and stomach. Reigns over Scotland, Holland, Africa, Constantinople, New York. Feminine and unfortunate.
interpretations.light: Fair complexion, grey eyes—the Moon's own sign
interpretations.shadow: Effeminate constitution, weak voice—'indicative of all changeable and mutable circumstances'

interpretations.story: Leo natives are 'of large body, broad shoulders, austere countenance, with dark eyes and tawny hair, strong voice, and leonine character, resolute and ambitious, but generous, free, and courteous.' Governs heart and back. Reigns over Italy, France, Rome, Philadelphia. Masculine and fortunate.
interpretations.light: Leonine character: resolute, ambitious, generous, free, courteous—the Sun's royal house
interpretations.shadow: Austere countenance—royalty demands its distance

interpretations.story: Virgo natives 'are of moderate stature, seldom handsome, slender but compact, thrifty and ingenious.' Governs abdomen. Reigns over Turkey, Greece, Crete, Jerusalem, Paris, Lyons. Feminine and 'generally unfortunate.'
interpretations.light: Thrifty, ingenious, compact—Mercury's practical house
interpretations.shadow: Seldom handsome, generally unfortunate—the maid's modest lot

interpretations.story: Libra natives are 'tall and well made, elegant in person, round-faced and ruddy, but plain-featured and inclined to eruptions that disfigure the face when old; they are of sweet disposition, just and upright in dealing.' Governs lumbar regions. Reigns over Austria, Portugal, India, Vienna, Charleston. Masculine and fortunate.
interpretations.light: Elegant, sweet disposition, just and upright—Venus brings beauty and balance
interpretations.shadow: Plain-featured and 'inclined to eruptions that disfigure the face when old'—time comes for all

interpretations.story: Scorpio natives are 'strong, corpulent, and robust, with large bones, dark curly hair and eyes (presumably the eyes dark only, not curly), middle stature, dusky complexion, active bodies; they are usually reserved in speech.' Governs the groin. Feminine and unfortunate. '(It would appear likely, by the way, that astrology was a purely masculine science.)'
interpretations.light: Strong, robust, active, reserved—Mars's nocturnal power
interpretations.shadow: Proctor's aside: astrology consistently marks feminine signs as unfortunate—suspicious pattern

interpretations.story: Sagittarius natives are 'well formed and tall, ruddy, handsome, and jovial, with fine clear eyes, chestnut hair, and oval fleshy face. They are generally jolly fellows at either bin or board, active, intrepid, generous, and obliging.' Governs thighs. Masculine and 'of course fortunate.'
interpretations.light: Jolly fellows at either bin or board—Jupiter's merry house
interpretations.shadow: Of course fortunate—because masculine (Proctor notes the pattern)

interpretations.story: Capricorn gives 'a dry constitution and slender make, with a long thin visage, thin beard (a generally goaty aspect, in fact), dark hair, long neck, narrow chin, and weak knees. It governs, nevertheless, the knees and hams.' Reigns over India, Greece, Mexico, Oxford. Feminine and unfortunate.
interpretations.light: Saturn's house of discipline and toil—there must be some virtue in that
interpretations.shadow: A generally goaty aspect, weak knees—unfortunate being feminine, as usual

interpretations.story: Aquarius natives are 'robust, steady, strong, healthy, and of middle stature; delicate complexion, clear but not pale, sandy hair, hazel eyes, and generally an honest disposition.' Governs legs and ankles. Reigns over Russia, Denmark, Hamburg, Bremen. Masculine and fortunate.
interpretations.light: Robust, honest, healthy—Saturn's better side in a masculine sign
interpretations.shadow: Even Saturn produces fortunate results when the sign is masculine

interpretations.story: Pisces natives are 'short, pale, thick-set, and round-shouldered (like fish), its character phlegmatic and effeminate.' Governs feet and toes. Reigns over Portugal, Spain, Egypt, Normandy. 'It is feminine, and therefore, naturally, unfortunate.'
interpretations.light: Jupiter's nocturnal house—some capacity for reverence and philosophy
interpretations.shadow: Round-shouldered like fish, phlegmatic, effeminate—'feminine, and therefore, naturally, unfortunate'

interpretations.story: The Ascendant House, rising above the horizon at the east, 'was regarded as the House of Life, the planets located therein at the moment of birth having most potent influence on the life and destiny of the native.' From this comes our expression that something is 'in the ascendant.' Angular and powerful.
interpretations.light: Life, destiny, beginnings—the most important house for the native
interpretations.shadow: If malefics occupy, the native's life and health suffer from the start

interpretations.story: The House of Riches, 'one-third of the way from the east below the horizon towards the place of the sun at midnight.' Succedent, supporting the angular first house. Material sustenance follows life itself.
interpretations.light: Riches, possessions, material security
interpretations.shadow: Or poverty, if malefics are found here

interpretations.story: The House of Kindred, short journeys, letters, messages. Two-thirds of the way toward midnight. Cadent and weak in power, preparing for the fourth house angle.
interpretations.light: Brothers, sisters, neighbors, communication, short travels
interpretations.shadow: Cadent houses are weakest—kindred may offer little support

interpretations.story: The House of Parents, at the midnight position of the sun. Angular and powerful. 'The place of the sun at midnight'—foundations, ancestry, endings.
interpretations.light: Parents, ancestry, lands, inheritance, the foundation of life
interpretations.shadow: Also 'the end of matters'—where things conclude

interpretations.story: The House of Children and Women, 'also of all sorts of amusements, theatres, banquets, and merry-making.' Succedent, supporting the fourth house. The pleasures that spring from secure foundations.
interpretations.light: Children, pleasure, creativity, amusement, theatres, banquets
interpretations.shadow: Excessive merry-making can squander what foundations provide

interpretations.story: The House of Sickness. Cadent and weak. Service, labor, and the ailments that come with them. The house before the Descendant, preparing for partnership through service.
interpretations.light: Service, daily work, health practices when well managed
interpretations.shadow: Sickness, servitude—the trials before relationship

interpretations.story: The House of Love and Marriage, at the western horizon where the sun sets. Angular and powerful. 'Opposite to the first'—what completes us lies across from our self.
interpretations.light: Marriage, partnership, love, contracts, committed relationships
interpretations.shadow: Also 'death (if afflicted)'—marriage unto death, one way or another

interpretations.story: The House of Death, 'the first house above the horizon, lying to the west.' Succedent, following the seventh. What marriage shares: resources, intimacy, and ultimately mortality.
interpretations.light: Inheritance, shared resources, transformation
interpretations.shadow: Death, fear, anxiety, the goods of the dead

interpretations.story: The House of Religion, science, learning, books, and long voyages. 'Next to the mid-heaven on the west.' Cadent, preparing for the culminating tenth house. The wisdom sought before worldly achievement.
interpretations.light: Religion, philosophy, higher learning, long journeys, divination
interpretations.shadow: Cadent weakness—knowledge without power to apply it

interpretations.story: The Mid-heaven, 'the region occupied by the sun at midday.' Angular and most visible. 'The House of Honour, denoting credit, renown, profession or calling, trade, preferment.' The peak of worldly achievement.
interpretations.light: Honor, profession, reputation, authority, achievement, visibility
interpretations.shadow: Empty honor, reputation without substance, the loneliness of the peak

interpretations.story: The House of Friends, 'next to the mid-heaven on the east.' Succedent, supporting the tenth. The allies who gather around our public position.
interpretations.light: Friends, hopes, benefactors, good fortune, future vision
interpretations.shadow: False friends, hopes disappointed—those who attach to success

interpretations.story: The House of Enemies. Cadent and weak. 'Even Lilly himself was indicted in 1655 because he had given judgment respecting stolen goods—apparently the twelfth house, House of Enemies, had caught up with him.'
interpretations.light: Solitude, retreat, hidden strengths, spiritual work
interpretations.shadow: Hidden enemies, imprisonment, self-undoing—the house that catches up with astrologers

interpretations.story: When planets occupy the same degree, their powers unite—'whether for good or ill, according to the nature of the stars involved.' The most powerful configuration, for better or worse.
interpretations.light: Fusion of powers, intensification, new beginnings
interpretations.shadow: Malefics in conjunction magnify each other's harm

interpretations.story: Sixty degrees apart, 'comprehending two signs.' Considered friendly because signs in sextile 'share the same gender but differ in element, producing harmony through difference.'
interpretations.light: Harmony through difference, friendly cooperation
interpretations.shadow: Mild benefit only—not powerful enough to overcome serious affliction

interpretations.story: Ninety degrees apart, 'comprehending three signs.' Considered inharmonious because signs in square 'share the same modality but are of contrary elements.'
interpretations.light: Tension that motivates action, crisis that builds strength
interpretations.shadow: Conflict, obstacles, frustration—the difficult aspect

interpretations.story: One hundred twenty degrees apart, 'comprehending four signs.' Considered 'most harmonious and beneficial, as signs in trine share the same element and thus the same essential nature.'
interpretations.light: Natural harmony, ease, blessing, grace
interpretations.shadow: Gifts taken for granted, complacency, unrealized potential

interpretations.story: One hundred eighty degrees apart, 'comprehending six signs.' Produces 'disharmony through complete separation, as opposing signs are furthest apart and thus contrary in influence.'
interpretations.light: Awareness through polarity, the tension that creates relationship
interpretations.shadow: Separation, contrary influences, the pull of opposites
